ccp4i2_header.pluginTitle: Crystal structure model refinement with servalcat.

qualifiers.toolTip: File containing model coordinates (PDB/mmCIF).
File containing structure factor amplitudes/intensities and uncertainties (F/SigF or I/SigI).
Free R set corresponding to the reflection data. See the "Generate a Free R set" task in the "Data reduction" section.
Half map 1 (MRC format)
Half map 2 (MRC format)
Map mask (MRC format)

qualifiers.guiLabel: ProSMART restraints for nucleic acid chains

qualifiers.toolTip: Additional keywords in a text file.
Restraint dictionary (mmCIF file) representing ideal geometry, e.g. for a ligand(s).
qualifiers.label: Ligand geometry

qualifiers.toolTip: Restraint dictionary (mmCIF file) representing ideal geometry, e.g. for a ligand(s).
qualifiers.label: Ligand geometry

qualifiers.toolTip: Add waters and perform further refinement.
Number of refinement cycles to perform after addition of water molecules.
High resolution (d_min)
Number of refinement cycles to perform.
Specify whether or not riding hydrogen atoms are to be used during refinement.

qualifiers.menuText: generate hydrogens,only if present in file
qualifiers.toolTip: Specify whether hydrogens are to be generated and used, or whether hydrogens are only to be used if already present in the input coordinate file.
Write hydrogen atoms in the output model
If automatic weighting is selected, Refmac will adjust the weight each refinement cycle in order to try and ensure reasonable geometry on average.
Constant weight controlling the relative contribution of data (reflections) and restraint (geometry) terms.
Do not adjust weight during refinement.
Minimum for the bond RMSZ range for weight adjustment. Default: 0.5.
Maximum for the bond RMSZ range for weight adjustment. Default: 1.0.
Restrain NCS-related molecules to ensure that they are structurally consistent with each other.
Use jelly-body restraints to stabilise refinement, ensuring that the model doesn't change too much from one cycle to the next (more cycles required).
Lower values allow the model to change less each cycle. Default: 0.01.
Maximum interatomic distance for jelly-body restraints. Controls flexibility. Default: 4.2.
Jelly body refinement only.
Detect covalent linkages based on the current atomic coordinates, and apply LINK records accordingly.
Specifies ADP parameterisation. Default: isotropic.
Use scattering factor for charged atoms.
Reset all ADPs to a fixed value prior to refinement.
Reset all ADPs to a given fixed value prior to refinement.
Shake coordinates with specified RMSD.
Specify for subunitary atomic occupancy parameters to be refined.
FreeR flag number for test set.
High resolution (d_min)
Specify whether it is known that the crystal is twinned (if in doubt, leave unticked).
Specify to use appropriate scattering factors for the experiment type.
Use work reflections in maximum-likelihood parameter estimates.
No positional restraints
Mask radius
Pixel size (in angstroem/pixel)
Point group
Ignore symmetry information (MTRIX/_struct_ncs_oper) in the input structure model file.
Helical twist (in degrees)
Helical rise (in angstroem)
Set origin of symmetry. Default is centre of the box.
Set origin of symmetry. Default is centre of the box.
Set origin of symmetry. Default is centre of the box.
Axis1 X (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold).
Axis1 Y (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold).
Axis1 Z (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold).
Axis2 X (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold, Dn: 2-fold).
Axis2 Y (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold, Dn: 2-fold).
Axis2 Z (if I: 5-fold, O: 4-fold, T: 3-fold, Dn: 2-fold).
Specify a B-value to blur (or sharp) a map. Mainly designed for oversharpened maps. This option does not affect output maps.
B-value - a positive value will blur a map. Mainly designed for oversharpened maps. This option does not affect output maps.
Run cross validation. Only "throughout" mode is available (no "shake" mode).
Minimum sigma to be used for external restraints.
Maximum sigma to be used for external restraints.
Minimum sigma to be used for external restraints.
Maximum sigma to be used for external restraints.
Specify electron form factor calculation method
Number of rigid body refinement cycles to perform.
